wikipedia_page.main: Lieutenant Colonel Frederick Cockayne Elton VC (23 April 1832 – 24 March 1888) was an English recipient of the Victoria Cross, the highest and most prestigious award for gallantry in the face of the enemy that can be awarded to British and Commonwealth forces.

link_mentions.page: List of English Victoria Cross recipients
response: |Frederick Cockayne Elton || British Army || 1855 || Crimean War || Sebastopol
It was the first Victoria Cross to be awarded to a member of the regiment. Alongside Major Frederick Cockayne Elton, Beach was presented with the VC by General Ferguson on 20 July 1857.
*Brevet Major Frederick Cockayne Elton, Crimean War (29 March 1855)
*Frederick Cockayne Elton, Crimean War recipient of the Victoria Cross
